results.title: La Maison des Cochons
results.brief_description: A claymation about an unsuspecting man whose fondness for baby pork is tantalised when he passes a restaurant that specialises in pig dishes. He is charmed and impressed by the service and ambience of the restaurant as he places his order with the waiter. The gruesome truth of the restaurant is soon revealed to the man when his dish arrives.

results.title: La Maison des Bories = the House of the Bories
results.brief_description:
Carl is the young scholar who comes to live with French geologist Julian and his wife Isabelle and two children. Carl is eager to study with the famous geologist, but soon he is involved in a love affair with his mentor’s wife.

Credits: Producer, Philippe Dussart ; director, Jacques Doniol-Valcroze ; writer, Anne Tromelin ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet.
Cast: Marie Dubois, Maurice Garrel, Helene Vallier, Mathieu Cariere, Veronique Maurin.

results.title: La Maison des Bois: Episode 7
results.brief_description:
Herve and his new family are back in Paris. Herve’s dad has great difficulty recovering from his war traumas and adjusting to civilian life. This causes enormous tension in the house and the children fear this may lead the family to the brink. When Papa Albert comes for a visit to report Maman Jeanne’s ill-health, Herve runs away from home to return to La Villeneuve.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Roger Duculot ; music, Maurice Ravel.
Cast: Pierre Doris, Jacqueline Dufranne, Agathe Natanson, Herve levy, Fernand Gravey, Maurice Pialat.

results.title: La Maison des Bois: Episode 6
results.brief_description:
The war is over and Maman Jeanne knows that Marcel will not return. For Herve and the children, the end of the war means leaving the Picards and returning to Paris. Herve’s dad and his new wife Helene come to the house in the woods for a visit. Herve gets to meet Brigitte, his new sister for the first time.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Roger Duculot ; music, Maurice Ravel.
Cast: Pierre Doris, Jacqueline Dufranne, Agathe Natanson, Herve Levy, Fernand Gravey, Maurice Pialat, Paul Crauchet, Barbara Laage.

results.title: La Maison des Bois: Episode 5
results.brief_description:
Herve accompanies papa Albert in the woods to track a poacher.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Roger Duculot ; music, Maurice Ravel.
Cast: Pierre Doris, Jacqueline Dufranne, Agathe Natanson, Herve Levy, Fernand Gravey, Maurice Pialat, Paul Crauchet.

results.title: La Maison des Bois: Episode 4
results.brief_description:
The kids visit Albert at the air field and Herve gets to fly in a plane with the lieutenant. As the groups prepares to leave, a German plane is spotted over the village of La Villeneuve.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Roger Duculot ; music, Maurice Ravel.
Cast: Pierre Doris, Jacqueline Dufranne, Agathe Natanson, Herve levy, Fernand Gravey, Maurice Pialat.

results.title: La Maison des Bois: Episode 3
results.brief_description:
The extented Picard family goes on a sunday picnic. Meanwhile Michel and Albert’s mothers come for a visit and stay stranded at the railway station. Marcel, Jeanne and Albert’s only son is deemed fit for service and is sent off to the renches together with Jacques, Marguerite’s fiance.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Roger Duculot ; music, Maurice Ravel.
Cast: Pierre Doris, Jacqueline Dufranne, Agathe Natanson, Herve levy, Fernand Gravey, Maurice Pialat.

results.title: La Maison des Bois: Episode 2
results.brief_description:
Herve and Michel trespass the property of Monsieur le Marquis (who is also Albert’s employer). The recenlty widowed Marquis befriends Herve. While on guard duty at the local air field, Papa Albert is caught stealing supplies from the officers’ pantry and Herve enlists the help of the Marquis to tell a white lie and get Albert off the hook. That Sunday, Albert and Michel’s mothers visit from Paris. These visits are always tough on Herve who has not seen his mother for three years.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Roger Duculot ; music, Maurice Ravel.
Cast: Pierre Doris, Jacqueline Dufranne, Agathe Natanson, Herve Levy, Fernand Gravey, Maurice Pialat, Micha Bayard, Marie-Christine Boulard.

results.title: La Maison des Bois: Episode 1
results.brief_description:
During WWI, Herve, Michel and Albert, three kids from Paris, have found shelter from life under the constant threat of bombing at the house of Albert Picard, a gamekeeper, his wife, Maman Jeanne and their two grown-up children, Marcel and Marguerite. The children attend the local school and also serve as choir boys at the local church. While helping the verger prepare for a funeral, they talk the all-too-willing man into tasting the mass wine. The series gives great insight into French village as well as the mores of the period as each episode brushes lightly on issues such as war, women’s condition, patriotism, education, etc… The story also follows closely Herve, the most sensitive of the children, as he searches for relationships that might help him overcome his sense of loss and abandonment. The series bears the trademark style of Maurice Pialat: strong realism, long takes, improvisation and wonderful performances from an ensemble cast of professional and non-professional actors.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Roger Duculot ; music, Maurice Ravel.
Cast: Pierre Doris, Jacqueline Dufranne, Agathe Natanson, Herve levy, Fernand Gravey, Maurice Pialat.

results.title: La Lutte contre le froid
results.creator_credit: Henri Gruel and Son et Lumiere
results.brief_description: An amusing and well made cartoon, light heartedly pouring scorn on our feeble efforts throughout the centuries to keep warm and resist the hardy since it can be used in so many forms and the widest range of heating systems. Blends animation and live action in an incisive and witty manner which can be enjoyed as much for its vigorous invention as for the precision of its technique.
